newsitem.title: JAPAN: BOT-Mitsubishi shares down on derivative loss news.
newsitem.headline: BOT-Mitsubishi shares down on derivative loss news.

text.p: Shares in Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi Ltd slid in Friday morning trade after Thursday's announcement that its U.S. unit had posted a loss from derivatives trading.
As of 0129 GMT, the shares were down 80 yen at 1,970 on turnover of 1.46 million shares, the fifth heaviest volume on the first section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange.
On Thursday, the bank announced that its U.S. unit had taken an appraisal loss of around $50 million from taking positions in such instruments as U.S. interest rate swaps.
Tokyo-Mitsubishi Derivative Products (USA), after having closed those positions, posted an after-tax loss of $83 million at its book closing in December 1996, the bank said.
The bank also said in a statement its U.S. unit had already informed U.S. and Japanese authorities of the losses.
It added that it had confirmed its U.S. unit had not broken any laws, regulations or internal rules, and thus regulators were not involved, the statement said.
